Package fate.core.ControlImplementations

Class CoreUI

java.lang.Object
fate.core.ControlImplementations.CoreUI
public class CoreUI extends Object
A utility class that serves as a container for UI-related helper methods and operations.

  • Method Details

    • removeHighlighter

      public static void removeHighlighter(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element) throws org.openqa.selenium.StaleElementReferenceException
      Removes the visual highlighter (border) from the specified web element. This method executes a JavaScript script to remove the border styling applied to an element. It includes a stale element check to avoid errors if the element is no longer attached to the DOM.
      Parameters:
      element - The WebElement from which to remove the highlighter (border).
      Throws:
      org.openqa.selenium.StaleElementReferenceException - If the element is no longer attached to the DOM when the action is performed.

    • highlightElement

      public static void highlightElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element, String... color) throws org.openqa.selenium.StaleElementReferenceException
      Highlights wanted element with red border or custom color.
      Parameters:
      element - Element to highlight.
      color - Default color "red" or specified.
      Throws:
      org.openqa.selenium.StaleElementReferenceException - Throws StaleElementEx if provided element is staled.

    • getScreenScalingfactor

      public static int getScreenScalingfactor(int currentScreenDpi)
      Returns current scaling factor of screen.
      Parameters:
      currentScreenDpi - Current DPI from windows settings.
      Returns:
      Scaling resolution factor in %. 0 if provided screen dpi is outside 96-480 dpi.

    • getScreenResolution

      public static org.openqa.selenium.Dimension getScreenResolution()
      Returns current screen resolution.
      Returns:
      Dimension object.

    • getTaskBarHeight

      public static int getTaskBarHeight()
      Returns the height of windows task bar in px.
      Returns:
      Height as int or MsgCode.NOT_FOUND_INT.

    • getElementsBodyPosition

      public static org.openqa.selenium.Point getElementsBodyPosition(org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)
      Returns elements position within body. Browser window must be opened, means container should also contain a WebDriver object, otherwise the function will fail and return '-1, -1' Point.
      Parameters:
      element - Wanted WebElement to find the position.
      Returns:
      Position as Point object.

    • getElementsScreenPosition

      public static org.openqa.selenium.Point getElementsScreenPosition(@Nonnull org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element)
      Return the screen position 'top left corner' of wanted element relative to screen. Browser window must be opened and maximized, means container should also contain a WebDriver object, otherwise the function will fail and return '-1, -1' Point.
      Parameters:
      element - Wanted element as WebElement.
      Returns:
      Screen position as Point.

    • scrollIntoView

      public static void scrollIntoView(@Nonnull org.openqa.selenium.WebElement element) throws org.openqa.selenium.StaleElementReferenceException
      Scrolls wanted element into view.
      Parameters:
      element - wanted element.
      Throws:
      org.openqa.selenium.StaleElementReferenceException

    • captureElement

      public static void captureElement(@Nonnull String selector, @Nonnull String fileName)
      Captures element according to it css selector from web driver The files will be saved in the same folder of Sikulix library
      Parameters:
      selector - String of the selector
      fileName - The name of file to save the captured image with it
      See Also:
      • ImageUtils

    • captureScreen

      public static void captureScreen(@Nonnull String fileName)
      Captures the entire screen of browser
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of image to be saved , for example image.png
